Module com.example.timescheduler
Package com.example.timescheduler.view

Class HomeView

java.lang.Object
com.example.timescheduler.view.HomeView
public class HomeView extends Object
This class is the controller of the home_view.fxml. It handles the user interactions with the home window and loads the required GUI components.

  • Constructor Details

    • HomeView

      public HomeView()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This function configures the layout of the home window when it is created. It requests and loads the events and initializes the admin panel.

    • onAddEvent

      protected void onAddEvent()
      This function is called when the add event button is pressed. It loads the create event component in the right half of the events panel.

    • onLogout

      protected void onLogout(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This function is called when the log out button is pressed. It navigates the user back to the login and registration window.
      Parameters:
      event - Event that represents the action that the corresponding button has been pressed.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception that occurs if an error arises in FXMLLoader.load.

    • onSwitchToAdminButton

      protected void onSwitchToAdminButton()
      This function is called when the button that loads the admin panel is pressed. When this happens, all user information is requested and the events panel is replaced with the admin panel.

    • onExportSchedule

      protected void onExportSchedule(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This function is called when the export button is pressed. It requests a pdf with the current schedule and opens a window where the user can choose a name and destination for the file.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Event that represents the action that the corresponding button has been pressed.

    • showEventsPanel

      public void showEventsPanel()
      This function is called after the button that switches back to the events panel is pressed. It requests to update the events list and handles loading the events panel.

    • updateAfterEditUser

      public void updateAfterEditUser()

    • deleteSelectedEvent

      public void deleteSelectedEvent()

    • notifyOnDownloadAtt

      public byte[] notifyOnDownloadAtt(long attId)

    • notifyOnGetSchedule

      public byte[] notifyOnGetSchedule()

    • notifyOnGetLoggedUser

      public User notifyOnGetLoggedUser()

    • notifyOnGetEvents

      public void notifyOnGetEvents()
      This function is used by the view to notify the listeners about a specific interaction. In this case, the view notifies the presenter that it needs a list of all events of this user.

    • notifyOnGetEventById

      public Event notifyOnGetEventById(long eventId)

    • notifyOnCreateEvent

      public void notifyOnCreateEvent(String name, Date date, Date duration, String location, Event.priorities priority, String[] participantMails, Date reminder, token token)

    • notifyOnEditEvent

      public void notifyOnEditEvent(Long eventId, String name, Date date, Date duration, String location, Event.priorities priority, Date reminder)

    • notifyOnAddParticipant

      public int notifyOnAddParticipant(String email)

    • notifyOnRemoveParticipant

      public int notifyOnRemoveParticipant(User user)

    • notifyOnAddAttachment

      public int notifyOnAddAttachment(String path)

    • notifyOnDeleteEvent

      public void notifyOnDeleteEvent()

    • notifyOnGetUsers

      public void notifyOnGetUsers()
      This function is used by the view to notify the listeners about a specific interaction. In this case, the view notifies the presenter that the admin panel is requested, so it needs a list of all users.

    • notifyOnEditUser

      public void notifyOnEditUser(String newUsername, String newName, String newEmail)
      This function is used by the view to notify the listeners about a specific interaction. In this case, the view notifies the presenter that the admin has edited a user and wants to save the changes.
      Parameters:
      newUsername - Updated username if the admin has modified it.
      newName - Updated name of the user if the admin has modified it.
      newEmail - Updated email address of the user if the admin has modified it.

    • notifyOnDeleteUser

      public void notifyOnDeleteUser(User user)
      This function is used by the view to notify the listeners about a specific interaction. In this case, the view notifies the presenter that the admin wants to delete a user account.
      Parameters:
      user - User object to be deleted.

    • notifyOnLogout

      public void notifyOnLogout()

    • updateEvents

      public void updateEvents()

    • addListener

      public void addListener(HomeViewListener listener)
      This function adds a listener to the HomeView which will from then on be notified when the user interacts with the GUI.
      Parameters:
      listener - Listener that implements the interface HomeViewListener (presenter).

    • isInGrid

      public boolean isInGrid(javafx.scene.Node node)
      This is a helper function that it used frequently to determine if a certain node is currently in the grid.
      Parameters:
      node - This is the node that should be searched in the grid.
      Returns:
      It returns true if the node is in the grid and false if it is not.

    • initializeDropDownMenus

      public void initializeDropDownMenus(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox timePicker, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox durationHPicker, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox durationMinPicker)
      This is a helper function that is used to initially set the values of all necessary drop-down menus.
      Parameters:
      timePicker - ComboBox that enables the user to choose the time of an event.
      durationHPicker - ComboBox that enables the user to pick how many hours the event will take.
      durationMinPicker - ComboBox that enables the user to pick how many minutes the event will take in addition to the hours.

    • formatTime

      public String formatTime(int h, int m)
      This is a helper function that converts a time given as hours and minutes to this format: hh:mm.
      Parameters:
      h - Hours.
      m - Minutes.
      Returns:
      Time in hh:mm format.

    • formatDate

      public String formatDate(Date date)
      This is a helper function that converts a date to this format: DayOfTheWeek dd.mm.yyyy hh:mm.
      Parameters:
      date - Date to be converted.
      Returns:
      Date in 'DayOfTheWeek dd.mm.yyyy hh:mm' format.

    • formatDuration

      public String formatDuration(Event event)
      This is a helper function that converts the duration of an event to this format: e.g. 1h 30min.
      Parameters:
      event - Event object that stores the start time of the event and the duration as a Date.
      Returns:
      String in the new format.

      public String convertReminderToString(Event event)
